titleStmt.title: Sabbatikh ʻhmepa ʻhmepa ʻimepa, Septima dies, dies desiderabilis, sabbatum Jehovae the seventh-day-sabbath the desirable day, the closing completing day of that first created week, which was, is, and will be, the just measure of all succeeding weeks in their successive courses, both for working in the six foregoing days, and for rest in the seventh, which is the last day, by an unchangeable law of well-established order, both in the revealed word and in created nature. The second part / by Francis Bampfield.
titleStmt.author: Bampfield, Francis, 1615 or 16-1683.

titleStmt.title: Sabbatikh ʻhmepa ʻhmepa ʻimepa, Septima dies, dies desiderabilis, sabbatum Jehovae the seventh-day-sabbath the desirable day, the closing completing day of that first created week, which was, is, and will be, the just measure of all succeeding weeks in their successive courses, both for working in the six foregoing days, and for rest in the seventh, which is the last day, by an unchangeable law of well-established order, both in the revealed word and in created nature. The second part / by Francis Bampfield.
titleStmt.author: Bampfield, Francis, 1615 or 16-1683.

notesStmt.note: First part of title transliterated from Greek.
"The summary contents of the second part of this treatise": p. [3]-[6]
"Errours in the margin are thus to be corrected in the second part": p. [7]
"Errours in the printing are thus to be corrected in the second part" p. [8]
Wing B268 in the second part of Wing B619, which may be found at reel 119:4.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
